name: Mitosis
text: Your space docks cannot produce infantry. At the start of the status phase, place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on any planet you control.

name: Raid Formation
text: When 1 or more of your units uses ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE: for each hit produced in excess of your opponent's fighters, choose 1 of your opponent's ships that has SUSTAIN DAMAGE to become damaged.

name: Zeal
text: You always vote first during the agenda phase. When you cast at least 1 vote, cast 1 additional vote for each player in the game including you.

name: Armada
text: The maximum number of non-fighter ships you can have in each system is equal to 2 more than the number of tokens in your fleet pool

name: Munitions Reserves
text: At the start of each round of space combat: You may spend 2 trade goods to re-roll any number of your dice during that combat round.

name: Galvanize
text: Galvanized units roll 1 additional die for combat rolls and unit abilities. When a game effect instructs a player to galvanize a unit. they place a galvanize token beneath it if it does not have one.

name: Liberate
text: When you gain control of a planet, ready that planet if it contains a number of your infantry equal to or greater than that planet's resource value; otherwise, place 1 infantry on that planet.

name: Phoenix Standard
text: At the end of combat, you may galvanize 1 of your units that participated.

name: Amalgamation
text: When you produce a unit, you may return 1 captured unit of that type to produce that unit without spending resources.

name: Devour
text: Capture your opponent's non-structure units that are destroyed during combat.

name: Riftmeld
text: When you research a unit upgrade technology, you may return 1 captured unit of that type to ignore all of the technology's prerequisites.

name: Incursion
text: When you activate a system that contains a breach, you may flip that breach; systems that contain active breaches are adjacent. at the end of the status phase, any player with ships in a system that contain an active breach may remove that breach.

name: Sorrow
text: When you create the game board, place the Sorrow (tile 94) where your home system would normally be placed, then place a inactive breach there. The Sorrow is not a home system. Then, place your home system (tile 118) in your play area.

name: Sundered
text: You cannot use wormholes other than epsilon wormholes. Other players' units that move or are placed into your home system are destroyed.

name: Oceanbound
text: Any time you have more ocean cards than there are planets that contain your coexisting units, discard ocean cards until you do not. When your units begin coexisting on a planet. gain an ocean card and ready it.

name: Research Team
text: When ground forces are committed, if your units on that planet are not already coexisting, you may choose for your units to coexist.

name: Aetherpassage
text: After a player activates a system, you may allow that player to move their ships through systems that contain your ships.

name: Dark Whispers
text: During setup, take the additional Empyrean faction promissory note; you have 2 faction promissory notes

name: Voidborn
text: Nebulae do not affect your ships' movement.

name: Plots Within Plots
text: You can score secret objectives already scored by other players if you fulfill their requirements; this does not count against your secret objective limit or the number you can score in a round. When you score another player's secret objective. do not gain a victory point; instead, place a facedown plot card into your play area with that player's control token on it.

name: Puppets of the Blade
text: If you have at least 1 plot card in your play area, gain the following ability: ACTION: Purge The Firmament's faction sheet, leaders, planet cards, and promissory note. Then, gain all of the faction components for The Obsidian.

name: Creuss Gate
text: When you create the game board, place the Creuss Gate (tile 17) where your home system would normally be placed. The Creuss Gate system is not a home system. Then, place your home system (tile 51) in your play area.

name: Quantum Entanglement
text: You treat all systems that contain either an alpha or beta wormhole as adjacent to each other. Game effects cannot prevent you from using this ability.

name: Slipstream
text: During your tactical actions, apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships that starts its movement in your home system or in a system that contains either an alpha or beta wormhole.

name: Arbiters
text: When you are negotiating a transaction, action cards can be exchanged as part of that transaction.

name: Guild Ships
text: You can negotiate transactions with players who are not your neighbor.

name: Masters of Trade
text: You do not have to spend a command token to resolve the secondary ability of the "Trade" strategy card.

name: Analytical
text: When you research a technology that is not a unit upgrade technology. You may ignore 1 prerequisite.

name: Brilliant
text: When you spend a command token to resolve the secondary ability of the "Technology" strategy card, you may resolve the primary ability instead.

name: Fragile
text: Apply -1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls.

name: Council Patronage
text: At the start of the strategy phase, replenish your commodities, then gain 1 trade good.

name: Law's Order
text: You may spend 1 influence at the start of your turn to treat all laws as blank until the end of your turn.

name: Law's Order Ω
text: You may spend 1 trade good or 1 commodity at the start of any player's turn to treat all laws as blank until the end of that turn.

name: The Tribuni
text: During setup, choose an unplayed faction from among the Mentak, the Xxcha and The Argent Flight; take that faction's home system, command tokens and control markers. Additionally, take the Keleres Hero that corresponds to that faction

name: The Tribuni Ω
text: During setup, choose a Keleres hero that corresponds to an unused faction (among The Xxcha Kingdom, The Mentak Coalition, and The Argent Flight); take that faction's home system, command tokens and control tokens. The unchosen Keleres heroes are not used.

name: Miniaturization
text: Your structures can be transported by any ship; this does not require or count against capacity. While your structures are in the space area, they cannot use their unit abilities. At the end of your tactical actions. you may place your structures that are in space areas onto planets you control in their respective systems.

name: Survival Instinct
text: After a player activates a system that contains your ships, you may move up to 2 of your ships into the active system from adjacent systems that do not contain your command tokens.

name: Assimilate
text: When you gain control of a planet, replace each PDS and space dock that is on that planet with a matching unit from your reinforcements.

name: Harrow
text: At the end of each round of ground combat, your ships in the active system may use their BOMBARDMENT abilities against your opponent's ground forces on the planet.

name: Edict
text: Other player's tokens in your fleet pool increase your fleet limit but cannot be redistributed. When you win a combat, place 1 command token from your opponent's reinforcements in your fleet pool if it does not already contain 1 of that player's tokens.

name: Hubris
text: During setup, purge your "Alliance" promissory note. Other players cannot give you their 'Alliance" promissory note.

name: Imperia
text: While another player's command token is in your fleet pool, you can use the ability of that player's commander, if it is unlocked.

name: Ambush
text: At the start of a space combat, you may roll 1 die for each of up to 2 of your cruisers or destroyers in the system. For each result equal to or greater than that ship's combat value, produce 1 hit; your opponent must assign it to 1 of their ships.

name: Pillage
text: After 1 of your neighbors gains trade goods or resolves a transaction, if they have 3 or more trade goods, you may take 1 of their trade goods or commodities.

name: Gashlai Physiology
text: Your ships can move through supernovae.

name: Star Forge
text: ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place either 2 fighters or 1 destroyer from your reinforcements in a system that contains 1 or more of your war suns.

name: Foresight
text: After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 or more of your ships, you may place 1 token from your strategy pool in an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships; move your ships from the active system into that system.

name: Telepathic
text: At the end of the strategy phase, place the Naalu "0" token on your strategy card; you are first in initiative order.

name: Galactic Threat
text: You cannot vote on agendas. Once per agenda phase, after an agenda is revealed. You may predict aloud the outcome of that agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 1 technology that is owned by a player who voted how you predicted.

name: Propagation
text: You cannot research technology. When you would research a technology, gain 3 command tokens instead.

name: Technological Singularity
text: Once per combat, after 1 of your opponent's units is destroyed, you may gain 1 technology that is owned by that player.

name: Future Sight
text: During the Agenda phase, after an outcome that you voted for or predicted is resolved, gain 1 trade good

name: The Company
text: During setup, take the 2 additional Nomad faction agents and place them next to your faction sheet; you have 3 agents

name: Distant Suns
text: When you explore a planet that contains 1 of your mechs, you may draw 1 additional card; choose 1 to resolve and discard the rest.

name: Fabrication
text: ACTION: Either purge 2 of your relic fragments of the same type to gain 1 relic; or purge 1 of your relic fragments to gain 1 command token.

name: Marionettes
text: The player or players whose control tokens are on each plot card are the puppeted players for that plot.

name: Nocturne
text: This faction cannot be chosen during setup.

name: The Blade's Orchestra
text: When this faction comes into play: flip your home system, double-sided faction components, and all of your in-play plot cards. Then, ready Cronos Hollow and Tallin Hollow if you control them.

name: Nomadic
text: You can score objectives even if you do not control the planets in your home system.

name: Scavenge
text: After you gain control of a planet, gain 1 trade good.

name: Unrelenting
text: Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls.

name: Orbital Drop
text: ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place 2 infantry from your reinforcements on 1 planet you control.

name: Versatile
text: When you gain command tokens during the status phase, gain 1 additional command token.

name: Awaken
text: After you activate a system that contains 1 or more of your sleeper tokens, you may replace each of those tokens with 1 PDS from your reinforcements.

name: Coalescence
text: If your flagship or your AWAKEN faction ability places your units into the same space area or onto the same planet as another player's units, your units must participate in combat during "Space Combat" or "Ground Combat" steps.

name: Terragenesis
text: After you explore a planet that does not have a sleeper token, you may place or move 1 sleeper token onto that planet.

name: Blood Ties
text: You do not have to spend influence to remove the custodians token from Mecatol Rex.

name: Reclamation
text: After you resolve a tactical action during which you gained control of Mecatol Rex, you may place 1 PDS and 1 space dock from your reinforcements on Mecatol Rex.

name: Peace Accords
text: After you resolve the primary or secondary ability of the "Diplomacy" strategy card, you may gain control of 1 planet other than Mecatol Rex that does not contain any units and is in a system that is adjacent to a planet you control.

name: Quash
text: When an agenda is revealed, you may spend 1 token from your strategy pool to discard that agenda and reveal 1 agenda from the top of the deck. Players vote on this agenda instead.

name: Devotion
text: After each space combat round, you may destroy 1 of your cruisers or destroyers in the active system to produce 1 hit and assign it to 1 of your opponent's ships in that system.

name: Indoctrination
text: At the start of a ground combat, you may spend 2 influence to replace 1 of your opponent's participating infantry with 1 infantry from your reinforcements.

name: Crafty
text: You can have any number of action cards in your hand. Game effects cannot prevent you from using this ability.

name: Scheming
text: When you draw 1 or more action cards, draw 1 additional action card. Then, choose and discard 1 action card from your hand.

name: Stall Tactics
text: ACTION: Discard 1 action card from your hand

name: Overwatch
text: After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 or more of your commands tokens: You may return that token to your reinforcements.

name: Indoctrination
text: At the start of a ground combat: You may spend 2 influence to replace 1 of your opponent's participating infantry with 1 infantry from your reinforcements.

name: Telepathic
text: At the end of the strategy phase. Place the Naalu "0" token on your strategy card; you are first in initiative order. This card cannot have a singularity token placed on it.

name: Yin Ascendant
text: When you score an objective: Draw 1 genome, ability, or unit upgrade.

name: Puppet Council
text: At the start of the strategy phase: Replenish your commodities, then gain 1 trade good.

name: Scheming
text: When you draw 1 or more action cards: Draw 1 additional action card. Then, choose and discard 1 action card from your hand.

name: Mirror Computing
text: When you spend trade goods: Each trade good is worth 2 resources or influence instead of 1.

name: Reclamation
text: After you resolve an action during which you gained control of a legendary planet: You may place 1 PDS and 1 space dock from your reinforcements on that planet.

name: Stellar Genesis
text: After you spend a token from your strategy pool: You may gain 1 trade good.

name: Aetherstream
text: After you or one of your neighbors activates a system that is adjacent to an anomaly: You may apply +1 to the move value of all of that player's ships during this tactical action.

name: Zealous
text: When 1 or more of your units roll dice for a unit ability: You may choose 1 of those units to roll 1 additional die.

name: Unrelenting
text: Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls.

name: Dimensional Tear
text: Systems that contain your space docks are also gravity rifts; your ships do not roll for these gravity rifts. Place a dimensional tear token beneath your space docks as a reminder.

name: Fleet Logistics
text: During each of your turns of the action phase, you may perform 2 actions instead of 1.

name: Terraform
text: Planets that contain your structures are treated as having all 3 planet traits (cultural, hazardous, and industrial).

name: Crucible
text: Your ships do not roll for gravity rifts; apply an additional +1 to the move values of your ships that would move out of or through a gravity rift instead.

name: Star Forge
text: ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place either 2 fighters or 1 destroyer from your reinforcements in a system that contains 1 or more of your ships.

name: Nullification Field
text: When another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your ships: You may exhaust this card and spend 1 token from your strategy pool to immediately end that player's turn.

name: Temporal Command Suite
text: After any player's genome becomes exhausted: You may spend a token to ready that genome; if you ready another player's genome, you may perform a transaction with that player.

name: Crafty
text: You can have any number of action cards in your hand. Game effects cannot prevent you from using this ability. During your turn of the action phase, players that have passed cannot play action cards.

name: Singularity Z
text: Once per combat, after 1 of your opponent's units is destroyed: You may place the "Singularity Z" token on one of your opponent's abilities. While that token is on a card, this card gains that card's text. You cannot place a singularity token on a card that already has a singularity token.

name: Singularity Y
text: Once per combat, after 1 of your opponent's units is destroyed: You may place the "Singularity Y" token on one of your opponent's abilities. While that token is on a card, this card gains that card's text. You cannot place a singularity token on a card that already has a singularity token.

name: Singularity X
text: Once per combat, after 1 of your opponent's units is destroyed: You may place the "Singularity X" token on one of your opponent's abilities. While that token is on a card, this card gains that card's text. You cannot place a singularity token on a card that already has a singularity token.

name: Amalgamation
text: Capture your opponent's non-structure units that are destroyed during combat. When you produce a unit, you may return 1 captured unit of that type to produce that unit without spending resources.

name: Supercharge
text: Before making a combat roll: Choose 1 of your units and apply +2 to the results of its combat roll.

name: Nomadic
text: You can score objectives even if you do not control the planets in your home system. Other players cannot activate asteroid fields that contain 1 or more of your ships.

name: Quantum Drive
text: You can produce your flagship without spending resources.

name: Quantum Entanglement
text: You treat all systems that contain either an alpha or beta wormhole as adjacent to each other. Game effects cannot prevent you from using this ability.

name: Lazax Gate Folding
text: During your tactical actions: Treat systems that contain legendary planets you do not control as if they contain both an alpha and beta wormhole.

name: Neuroglaive
text: After another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your ships: That player removes 1 token from their fleet pool and returns it to their reinforcements.

name: Nanomachines
text: ACTION: Exhaust this card to place 1 PDS on a planet you control. ACTION: Exhaust this card to repair all of your damaged units. ACTION: Exhaust this card and discard 1 action card to draw 1 action card.

name: Valkyrie Particle Weave
text: After making combat rolls during a round of ground combat: If your opponent produced 1 or more hits, you produce 1 additional hit.

name: Tactical Brilliance
text: After you roll dice for a unit ability: You may reroll any of those dice.

name: Aerie Hololattice
text: Other players cannot move ships throuhg systems that contain your structures. Each planet that contains 1 or more of your structures gains the PRODUCTION 1 ability as if it were a unit.

name: Fabrication
text: ACTION: Either purge 2 of your relic fragments of the same type to gain 1 relic; or purge 1 of your relic fragments to gain 1 command token.

name: Spec Ops Training
text: After 1 of your ground forces is destroyed: Roll 1 die. If the result is 5 or greater, place the unit on this card. At the start of your next turn, place each unit that is on this card on a planet you control in your home system.

name: Bioplasmosis
text: At the end of the status pahse: You may remove any number of ground forces from planets you control and place them on 1 or more planets you control in the same or adjacent systems.

name: Devotion
text: After each space combat round: You may destroy 1 of your cruisers or destroyers in the active system to produce 1 hit and assign it to 1 of your opponent's ships in that system.

name: Foresight
text: After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 or more of your ships: You may place 1 command token from your reinforcements in an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships; mvoe your ships from the active system into that system.

name: Voidborn
text: Nebulae do not affect your ships' movement. You can allow other players to move their ships through systems that contain your ships.

name: Quantum Datahub Node
text: At the end of the strategy phase: You may spend 1 token from your strategy pool and give another player 3 of your trade goods. If you do, give 1 of your strategy cards to that player and take 1 of their strategy cards.

name: Neural Parasite
text: At the start of your turn: Destroy 1 of another player's infantry in or adjacent to a system that contains your infantry.

name: Munitions Reserves
text: At the start of each round of space combat: You may spend 2 trade goods; you may reroll any number of your dice during this combat round.

name: Bio-Synthetic Synergy
text: Your action cards cannot be canceled by "Shatter" action cards. Your other abilities cannot be taken, purged, or discarded by other players and cannot have singularity tokens placed on them.

name: Pillage
text: After 1 of your neighbors gains trade goods or resolves a transaction: If they have 3 or more trade goods, you may take 1 of their trade goods or commodities.

name: Courier Transport
text: After you activate a system: You may move your structures from adjacent systems that do not contain your command tokens onto planets you control in the activate system

name: Dimensional Splicer
text: At the start of space combat in a system that contains a wormhole and 1 or more of your ships: You may produce 1 hit and assign it to 1 of your opponent's ships.

name: Ambush
text: At the start of a space combat: You may roll 1 die for each of up to 2 of your cruisers or destroyers in the system. For each result equal to or greater than that ship's combat value, produce 1 hit; your opponent must assign it to 1 of their ships.

name: Agency Supply Network
text: Once per action, when you resolve a unit's PRODUCTION ability: You may resolve another of your unit's PRODUCTION abilities in any system.

name: Liberate
text: When you gain control of a planet: Ready that planet if it contains a number of your infantry equal to or greater than that planet's resource value; otherwise, place 1 infantry on that planet.

name: Future Path
text: When you gain trade goods from choosing a previously unchosen strategy card ot from the "Amicus" strategy card: Triple those trade goods.

name: Pacifist
text: When ground forces are committed: If your units on that planet are not already coexisting, you may choose for your units to coexist.

name: Abundance
text: When 1 or more of your units use  PRODUCTION, you may gain 1 trade good.

name: Peace Accords
text: After you spend a token from your stategy pool: You may gain control of 1 planet that does not contain the custodians token or any units and is adjacent to a planet you control.

name: Spatial Conduit Cylinder
text: After you activate a system that contains 1 or more of your units: That system is adjacent to all other systems that contain 1 or more of your units during this action.

name: Subatomic Splicer
text: When one of your ships is destroyed: You may produce a ship of the same type at a space dock in your home system.

name: Sled Factories
text: When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION: Reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 2.

name: Raid Formation
text: When 1 or more if your units uses ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE: For each hit produced in excess of your opponent's fighters, choose 1 of your opponent's ships that has SUSTAIN DAMAGE to become damaged.

name: Planesplitter
text: When you gain this card, put The Fracture into play. Apply +1 to the MOVE value of each of your ships that starts its movement in The Fracture. Apply +2 to the result of each of your units' combat rolls in The Fracture.

name: Genetic Research
text: At the start of the status phase: Choose a technology color and gain trade goods equal to the number of abilities you own that have that technology color.

name: Instinct Training
text: When another player plays an action card: You may spend 1 token from your strategy pool to cancel that action card.

name: Hegemonic Trade Policy
text: When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION: You may swap the resource and influence values of 1 planet you control during this use of PRODUCTION.

name: Inheritance Systems
text: During the status phase: Draw 1 additional action card and gain 1 additional command token.

name: Stall Tactics
text: ACTION: Discard 1 action card from your hand.

name: Proxima Targeting VI
text: Cancel 1 hit produced by each BOMBARDMENT roll against your units. At the start of a round of ground combat, you may resolve BOMBARDMENT 7(x3) against your opponent's ground forces; if you do, resolve BOMBARDMENT 7(x3) against your own ground forces.

name: Non-Euclidean Shielding
text: When 1 of your units uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE: Cancel 2 hits instead of 1.

name: Assimilate
text: When you gain control of a planet: Replace each structure on that planet with a matching unit from your reinforcements.

name: Mitosis
text: At the start of the status phase: Place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on any planet you control.

name: Awaken
text: After you activate a system that contains 1 or more of your infantry, you may replace 1 of those infantry with a PDS from your reinforcements.

name: Entropic Harvest
text: At the end of any player's combat: Gain 1 commodity or convert 1 of your commodities to a trade good.

name: Orbital Drop
text: ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place 2 infantry from your reinforcements on 1 planet you control.

name: Survival Instinct
text: After a player activates a system that contains your ships: You may move up to 2 of your ships into the active system from adjacent systems that do not contain your command tokens.

name: Radical Advancement
text: At the start of the status phase: You may choose to replace 1 of your abilities; If you do, reveal abilities from the deck until you reveal another ability with the same technology color and gain it; shuffle the replaced ability and the other revealed cards back into the deck.

name: E-Res Siphons
text: After  another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your ships: Gain 4 trade goods.

name: Slipstream
text: During your tactical actions: Apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships that starts its movement in a system that contains a wormhole.

name: Magmus Reactor
text: Your units can move into and through supernovas. Each supernova that does not contain other players' units and each system that contains 1 or more of your war suns gains the PRODUCTION 5 as if it were one of your units.

name: Versatile
text: When you gain command tokens during the status phase: Gain 1 additional command token.

name: Guild Ships
text: You can negotiate transactions with players who are not your neighbor. You can exchange action cards with other players as part of transactions.

name: Armada
text: The maximum number of non-fighter ships you can have in each system is equal to 2 more than the number of tokens in your fleet pool

name: Smothering Presence
text: Other players' units in or adjacent to systems that contain your structures lose all of their unit abilities.

name: Scavenge
text: After you gain control of a planet: Gain 1 trade good.

name: Stymie
text: After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 or more of your units: You may place 1 command token from that player's reinforcements in any non-home system.

name: Harrow
text: At the end of each round of ground combat: Your ships in the active system may use their BOMBARDMENT abilities against your opponent's ground forces on the planet.

name: The Burning Eye
text: You can treat planets in systems that contain your ships as if you controlled them for the purpose of scoring secret objectives.

name: Chaos Mapping
text: At the start of your turn during the action phase: You may produce 1 unit in a system that contains at least 1 of your units that has PRODUCTION.

name: Valkyrie Vanguard
text: During the "Commit Ground Forces" step: You can commit up to 1 ground force from each planet in the active system and each planet in adjacent systems that do not contain 1 of your command tokens.

name: Distant Suns
text: When you explore a planet that contains 1 of your mechs: You may draw 1 additional card; choose 1 to resolve and discard the rest.
